intro: Stylidium glaucum subsp. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sun-orchid, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, bright orange or yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and a short, erect stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sandplains. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it a notable species in its native environment.
